intro: Caopia glabra, commonly known as the smooth caopia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and opposite leaves that are usually ovate in shape. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a distinctive corona. Caopia glabra is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
